content.raw:
For error `[Wrn] [SystemPaths.cc:459] File or path does not exist [""] [model://wamv_gazebo/mesh/gps.dae] `

  
If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo`, it looks for the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo` \+ `/wamv_gazebo/mesh/gps.dae`, which works if we add the directory and symlink. However, it expects ALL subdirectories in `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_gazebo` to have a model.config file.

content.raw:
I’m starting to understand how this works. If the error is

```
[Wrn] [SystemPaths.cc:459] File or path does not exist [""] [model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae]
```

  
It searches EXACTLY for `model://vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae` relative to the model path. 

‌

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx`, it works \(finds the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`. 

If `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models`, it doesn’t work \(can’t find the file\), as it can find the file at `/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models` \+ `/vrx_gazebo/models/sensor_post/mesh/sensor_post_arm.dae`, which is nonsense.

**Steps**

Added directory and symlink to match above:

```
└── wamv_description
    ├── mesh -> ../mesh
    └── model.config
```

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description` \(replace tylerlum with <username>\)

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true`

Manually delete wamv model \(click on boat, right click, delete\)

ERROR:

```
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description/mesh"
[Err] [InsertModelWidget.cc:433] Missing model.config for model "/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description/urdf"
```

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

`gz model --model-name=wamv --spawn-file=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

I found that this solution was insufficient.

Steps

Added directory and symlink to match above:

.
├── CHANGELOG.rst

Terminal 1

export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/vrx_gazebo/models:/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx/wamv_description (replace tylerlum with <username>)

roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true

Manually delete wamv model (click on boat, right click, delete)

It appears that for each path in GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH, it checks ALL its subdirectories for a model.config file.

gz model --model-name=wamv --spawn-file=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf

content.raw:
@{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} and I were discussing about this. All `package://` lines are converted into `model://` while parsing it by sdformat. That means, all is relative to the model directories specified by `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. I don’t think we have a clean solution here to avoid the errors. One “workaround” could be to do something like this:

```
wamv_description
|-- CHANGELOG.rst
|-- CMakeLists.txt
|-- mesh
|   |-- WAM-V-Base.dae
|   |-- WamV.png
|   |-- engine.dae
|   `-- propeller.dae
|-- package.xml
|-- urdf
|   |-- battery.xacro
|   |-- cpu_cases.xacro
|   |-- thrusters
|   |   `-- engine.xacro
|   `-- wamv_base.urdf.xacro
`-- wamv_description
    |-- mesh -> ../mesh/
    `-- model.config
```

and set the `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` to the top level `wamv_description` directory. Essentially, a new subdirectory with the Gazebo model structure including a symbolic link to the `mesh` directory for avoiding extra copies of the meshes. I don't think we need the `model.sdf` file, just `model.config` is fine to avoid the errors.

At a high-level, the model being spawned is the wamv \(boat\), which described by a URDF file created before runtime. \(eg. $HOME/my\_urdf.urdf\).

The issue is that this urdf includes `.dae` files that it cannot find, unless I set `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. These both include models such as `[model://vrx_gazebo/models/3d_lidar/mesh/3d_lidar.dae]`, but also `.dae` files that are not currently models such as `[model://wamv_description/mesh/engine.dae]`.

From what you said, I believe setting `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` to /home/tylerlum/vrx\_ws/src/vrx/vrx\_gazebo/models makes sense

```
vrx_gazebo/models

│   ├── model.config
```

**How to Run**

_Terminal 1_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`export GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH=/home/tylerlum/vrx_ws/src/vrx` \(replace tylerlum with <username>\)

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true`

Manually delete wamv model \(click on boat, right click, delete\)

‌

_Terminal 2_

`source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo generate_wamv.launch wamv_target:=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

`gz model --model-name=wamv --spawn-file=$HOME/my_urdf.urdf`

‌

WORKS. Model shows immediately!

roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch verbose:=true and delete the wamv model

gz model --model-name=wamv --spawn-file=/home/tylerlum/vrx-docker/generated/team_generated/example_team/example_team.urdf long delay….

wamv created, but then can’t find .dae files

content.raw: Maybe we can even do everything inside the `.launch` file.
content.html: Maybe we can even do everything inside the .launch file.

content.raw:
@{557058:684383ab-ac95-4859-a350-4a6f41a94a22} and I were discussing this issue. We "think" this strategy might work with the `enable_ros_network` solution in parallel:

1. Replace the `<node name="spawn_model" ...` call in our launch files with another call to a custom node.
2. This custom node reads the `robot_description` value from the ROS parameter server.
3. Then, calls the external command `gz model -s <string>`, where <string> is the value read in step \(2\). Note that this step requires gz transport to work but it should because we're inside the simulation container.
content.html:
@Shane Loretz and I were discussing this issue. We "think" this strategy might work with the enable_ros_network solution in parallel:

  1. Replace the <node name="spawn_model" ... call in our launch files with another call to a custom node.
  2. This custom node reads the robot_description value from the ROS parameter server.
  3. Then, calls the external command gz model -s <string>, where <string> is the value read in step (2). Note that this step requires gz transport to work but it should because we're inside the simulation container.

content.html: Should not be merged yet until we have fully figured out how spawn_model should work, as we don’t want people to set things up such that the WAM-V can’t spawn

update.description:
Note: This PR does not necessarily need to be merged in, but should be discussed.

**Description**

This PR is to discuss the `enable_ros_network` argument, which is described below.

For the purpose of competition, we need to limit the exposed ROS and Gazebo topics to the ones that competitors should be able to use. There are three types:

1. Gazebo transport topics - being solved by Docker containers that have no Gazebo transport topic communication
2. ROS VRX topics - these can be hidden by setting an environment variable \(should already be set\)
3. ROS topics with gazebo namespace - \(eg. /gazebo/model\_states\). This should be handled by `enable_ros_network` parameter for Gazebo. 

**Issue**

This should work, but the only issue is that we call `spawn_model` in launch files to spawn the WAM-V. However, this uses one of the topics hidden by `enable_ros_network:=false`. Source code: [https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo\_ros\_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo\_ros/scripts/spawn\_model](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/blob/melodic-devel/gazebo_ros/scripts/spawn_model)

**Question**

Can we change how we spawn the model or do we have to make another branch of Gazebo?

Also, should we even keep this argument, or should we just manually add it to `extra_gazebo_args`?
update.title: Add enable_ros_network argument

content.raw: To use: source workspace then run `roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch enable_ros_network:=true`
content.html: To use: source workspace then run roslaunch vrx_gazebo sandisland.launch enable_ros_network:=true
